article:
'Metre per second' (U.S. spelling: 'meter per second') is an SI derived unit of
both speed (scalar) and velocity (vector quantity which specifies both
magnitude and a specific direction), defined by distance in metres divided by
time in seconds.

The SI unit symbols are mÂ·s â1 , m s â1 , m/s, or . [http://www.bipm.org/en/si/si_brochure/chapter5/5-
1.html SI brochure, Section 5.1] Where metres per second are several
orders of magnitude too slow to be convenient, such as in astronomical
measurements, velocities may be given in kilometres per second, where
1 km/s is 1000 metres per second.
